question:
Is the following statement something you would say?
"I prefer to take advantages now rather than wait for possible better alternatives in future"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am good at delaying gratification and working towards long-term goals"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I can wait long periods of time to achieve my desired goals"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am willing to wait or delay gratification long periods of time to achieve my aims"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am willing to wait for long-term gains and put in the effort over time to reach my goals"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I prefer quick, immediate rewards over long-term satisfaction"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I believe in putting off immediate gratification for the sake of long-term goals"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I prefer to get what I want quickly, regardless of the consequences"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I believe it is best to focus on immediate short-term pleasure over long-term gain"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I prefer to have my desires and pleasures now rather than later"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I prefer satisfying my wants and needs quickly rather than waiting"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"There is no rush"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"It doesn't bother me to wait to achieve something I want"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I want results now and am not willing to wait"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am impatient and can't wait to get what I want or accomplish my goals"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I place sufficient value on future satisfaction to be able to wait long time periods before getting desired rewards"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am able to make plans for far off in the future and wait patiently for those goals"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"It is easy to wait for things, and it is OK to delay gratification"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I prefer short-term benefits over long-term benefits"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am impatient and like to achieve my goals as soon as possible"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I prefer instant gratification over long-term satisfaction"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I want immediate satisfaction and seldom wait for payoffs in the future, no matter their magnitude"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"People should always put off short-term pleasures for the sake of long-term happiness"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I want what I want when I want it"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am good at working to achieve long-term goals rather than focusing on short-term gain"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I want benefits and rewards now"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I value the pleasure of instant gratification more than the long-term benefits of waiting"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I enjoy long-term accomplishments and rewards much more than short-term ones"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I want instant results"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I value long-term goals over short-term objectives"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I enjoy waiting for good outcomes"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I'd rather see immediate, short-term benefits than work towards long term goals"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I want rewards now, not later"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I need quick results, and I can't wait a long period of time to see them"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"Since I have a short time horizon, I prefer immediate rewards and often neglect long-term consequences of my choices"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"Money now is better than money later"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am patient enough to wait for outcomes in the long run"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am always prepared to wait and achieve results over the long term rather than jump to quick, short-term solutions"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I focus a lot on long-term goals"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I care more about the here and now than the future"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I do not care much about the future; I focus mainly on what I can get now"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am prepared to sacrifice short-term gratification for long-term objectives"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I prefer instant results over long-term gains"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I would rather see results from my efforts quickly than wait for potentially better results in the future"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am willing to wait long periods of time to accomplish my goals"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I want immediate results, even if it means sacrificing long-term success"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I like to wait for rewards"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I am impatient and don't like waiting long periods of time to get what I want"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"People should enjoy things now and not postpone them into the far future"

Is the following statement something you would say?
"I can usually wait for weeks or months to achieve my goals"
